name: Countess of Computers
description: British mathematician Ada Lovelace studies Charles Babbage’s “difference engine.” She is, arguably, the first computer programmer in the world.

name: Seneca Falls Convention
description: The first convention for women’s rights actually organized by women and one of the first efforts of an organized women’s rights movement.

name: Only Scientist to Win Nobel Prizes in Two Scientific Fields
description: Polish-born French physicist Marie Curie isolates pure radium, and later that year she wins a share of the Nobel Prize for Physics, the first of her two Nobel Prizes.

name: Ratification of the 19th Amendment
description: After decades of fighting for the right to vote, women finally acheieve suffrage with the ratification of the 19th Amendment.

name: Insights into DNA
description: British scientist Rosalind Franklin joins the Biophysical Laboratory at King’s College, where she conducts groundbreaking research on DNA that contributes to the discovery of its molecular structure.

name: Equal Pay Act
description: Then-President John F. Kennedy signs the Equal Pay Act, which requires employers to pay equal wages for the same work, regardless of the employee’s gender.

name: Architect of Gender Equity in Education
description: Patsy Mink, a key author for Title IX, a law that advanced gender equity within federal funding policies for educatio, becomes the first woman of color elected to the U.S. House of Representatives.

name: From Stonewall to STAR
description: Latina American transgender activist Sylvia Rivera incites resistance in the Stonewall Riots in NYC. She later co-founds the Street Transvestite Action Revolutionaries (STAR) with Marsha P. Johnson, providing homes for homeless trans people.

name: Champion of Labor Rights
description: A sucessful union contract is finalized due to nationwide table grape boycotts driven by Dolores Huerta, an American labor leader and feminist activist.

name: Battle of the Sexes
description: 90 million people worldwide watch Billie Jean King defeat Bobby Riggs in the Battle of the Sexes tennis match.

name: First American Woman to Fly in Space
description: Flying on the Space Shuttle Challenger, Sally Ride, a physicist and astronaut, becomes the first American woman in space.

name: Serena Slam
description: Serena Williams defeats her older sister, Venus, at the Australian Open. She becomes the fifth woman to hold all four major singles Grand Slam titles at one time.

name: Mia Hamm Inducted Into the World Football Hall of Fame
description: Two-time FIFA Women's World Cup winner and two-time Olympic gold medalist, Mia Hamm becomes the first woman to recieve the honor.

name: Treatment Saves Millions of Lives
description: Chinese pharmaceutical chemist Tu Youyou recieves the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for her discovery of artemisinin, a revolutionary malaria treatment derived from traditional Chinese medicine.

name: First Woman, First Black American, and First South Asian American
description: Kamala Harris is sworn in as the first woman and first woman of color vice president of the United States.
